channel.title: Okay
channel.description: Woot, another moparscape moderator. Grats Telenubby. But liek, why is Click Here still a mod? I think it is not coincidental that he just happened to be active on March 25 and locked two topics, when he hasnt even posted since some time in January before that. Can someone explain to me why he is a mod if he doesn't do anything?

item.dc:creator: @Tico135 Tico
item.description:
@Tico135 wrote:

I really don’t see a problem with him still holding a moderator status, he has done nothing wrong, inactivity is not a reason to demod someone unless they disappeared and after months, some action could be taken (referring to the fact of StarBlaster’s de-admin). Overall he does come on and moderate when he can, and that’s all I think should be asked of him.

item.title: Okay
item.dc:creator: @Tree Tree
item.description:
@Tree wrote:

real question is why does it matter to you or really anyone? he was chosen and thats all that matters, if he was doing something wrong yes understandable, but inactivity shouldn't be punishable it should be welcomed!

If power is inactive, then it is wasted. Power that is wasted could have been assigned elsewhere so that it actually does something.

Maybe it is simply because I haven't got around to de-modding him yet? But as silab said, it doesn't really matter, he isn't hurting anyone.

So that’s where the epic amount of fail leaked from?

Read full topic

item.title: Okay
item.dc:creator: @TeleNubby TeleNubby
item.description:
@TeleNubby wrote:

I’m 50% sided with you, Taharok, but my other 50% goes to Silab here. You’re both right, but in the end, I guess its the administraitors decision.

EDIT: Here’s my actual view on this.

Click Here has been inactive, yes, which could mean a number of things. He could be on a super long vacation (doubtfully), busy with real-life matters, etc. The problem to me is, he hasnt told anybody his reason. Following that, his inactivity could mean little respect or little care for this community. A moderator with little care for a community in-deep-need of care is, probably, not what most people think of as a staff member. Now, extending Silab’s point of view, he hasnt done anything wrong. Meaning, there is no real reason to demote him except for the ‘little care’ perspective. Silab mentioned his inactivity should not be punishable but welcomed. Well, there are two sides from that. It all depends on how you look at it. Inactivity should not be welcomed if it is a result of little or no responsibility/care, but it can be welcomed because ‘he has moved on and has gotten a life.’ On that little statement, I side with the ‘should-be-demoted’ reason. But its not all up to me.

Read full topic

item.title: Okay

item.description:

the real question is why does it matter to you or really anyone? he was chosen and thats all that matters, if he was doing something wrong yes understandable, but inactivity shouldn’t be punishable it should be welcomed!
